did.unittitle: American Philosophical Society Archives. Record Group IIa
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the American Philosophical Society Archives. For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

did.unittitle: Papers
BRACKETED DATES
Letter to John Vaughan;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. Presents West Indian objects to the APS through his brother, J.Vaughan. On same sheet as letter from J.Vaughan to B.Franklin; Dec.18,1789. Film 54-57 Frame 78

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Franklin, Pres. of A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. Financial complications; possibility of suit being instituted against him. FILM 54-57 FRAME 76

did.unittitle: Letter to J. P. Lesley;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rantoul, Ill., A.L.S.: A. H. Bailey, president. 1p., seal. Apprises A.P.S. of progress made by his society.

did.unittitle: Particular account of the Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London bound;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D. 3p.and end. List of Transactions in possession of the APS. Notes certain volumes bond "not of D[r.] Franklins."

did.unittitle: Settlement of accounts left unpaid by Samuel Vaughan;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S.with initials. 1p.

did.unittitle: Letter to W. Roxburgh;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sunday. L.S. 1p.and add. Concerning a skeleton.

did.unittitle: Bill of mortality;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside. 1p. O. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no. 22a.) Cf. Minutes, p.334. Enclosed originally in letter from Spalding to J.R. Coxe; Feb. 21, 1803. Pres. by Lyman Spalding; (reed.)4 March 1803.

did.unittitle: J[oseph] Priestley to the members of the American Philosophical Society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p. A.L.S. Accepts invitation to dine with the members of the Society. See Pro., XXII, pt. 3, 334.

did.unittitle: Letter to Tho[mas] Jefferson, Washington;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Harrodsburg, A.L.S. 3p. and add., end. (see Ms. Comm. to APS. Phil.,Lit.,Ant.,Geo. Education. vol. 1, no.17.) Concerning Writing and spelling.

did.unittitle: NOT FOUND
Extract from the history of the Royal Society of London,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Read before A.P.S., 2pp. and endorsement. D.S.: Wm. Jones; endorsed, Jn. Vaughan. Copy. From original copy read by B. Franklin. Notation by John Vaughan that treasurer should bring suit against members who refuse payment of their arrears.

did.unittitle: Concerning telegraphy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [received from William Dunbar]; Jan.16, D. 7p.and end. Copy. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Mechanics, Machinery, Eng., etc., no. 22.) Delivered originally before the Royal Society of London. Printed: Hooke's Phil. (Hobson's Extracts) p.142.

did.unittitle: Letter to Rev. St. George, (bishop of Clagher);

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Belturbet, L. Copy. 4p. (see Ms.comm. to the APS. Natural history, vol. 1, no. 4.) Concerning a fossil bone.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Archbishop of Ireland;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.]. L. Extract. 12p.and drawing of 1p. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural history, vol. 2, no. 54.) Concerning mammoth fossil teeth. Enclosed originally in letter from Bogert to J.Vaughan; Dec. 20, 1817.

did.unittitle: Meteorological observations
Concerning the parhelia rainbows and halo which appeared in Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [presented by George Logan] May 20, 1816. D.S. 1p.and end. (see Ms.Comm. to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 52.) For the account of this phenomenon, see: Account of two parhelia; Dec. 21, 1756.

did.unittitle: Caradoc, Sir John Francis,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: see

did.unittitle: Proposals for enlarging this Society in order that it may the better answer the End for which it was instituted, namely, the promoting and propagating useful knowledge;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 10p. (see Minutes of the Junto and American society for promoting useful knowledge (in middle of volume), pp.61-70.) Printed (with slightly different wording) APS. Transactions, vol.I,o.s Preface

did.unittitle: Catalogue of donations to the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 58p. Compiled by Mr. Hunersdorff. Cf. A.P.S. Curators' Annual report for 1901. Pages 15, 38 missing.

did.unittitle: Letter to [the American philosophical society?];

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia County, L. Copy. 4p. (see Ms. Comm. to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 2.) Concerning Carter's article on the fly weevil and a cure for it.

did.unittitle: Frederic Guyer to the [American] Philosophical society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: ----, 3 pp., address and endorsement. A.Com.S. Method of ascertaining the longitude by lunar observation, submitted for Magellanic premium. Read, January 15, 1796 See Pro., xxII, pt. 3, 236.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Benjamin Franklin, Craven Street;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Greenwich, A.L. in 3d.P. 3p. and add., end. Mutilated. (see Ms.Comm.to APS. Math and Astronomy, vol. 1, no. 6.) Concerning the transit of Venus of 1769. Printed: APS Trans.,v.1,ed.1,p.90.

did.unittitle: Letter to Benj[amin] Franklin, Craven Street;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Greenwich, A.L.S. 2p. and add., end. (see Ms.Comm.to APS. Math and Astronomy, vol. 1, no.7.) Transit of Venus of 1769 and concerning the Philadelphia group.

did.unittitle: Letter to [William] Smith;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Greenwich, A.L.S. 2p.and end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Math. and astronomy, vol. 1, no. 5.) Concerning the transit of Venus. Refers to Rittenhouse and Mason and Dixon. Cf. Minutes, p.56.

did.unittitle: Concerning the contents of the first volume of the Transactions;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.]. D. 3p. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Math.and astronomy, vol.1,no.12.) Mostly astronomical observations in this document.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Buckingham Co.,Va., L.S. 2p.and add.,end. Add.mutilated. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 3.) Sends recipe for making Pompion ale.

did.unittitle: Letter to Moses Bartram, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Bradford, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Math.and astronomy, vol. 1, no. 9.) Concerning sun-spots and silk worms.

did.unittitle: Concerning some obvious phenomena of light;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [read] D. 3p.and end. (see Ms. comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 3.)

did.unittitle: Letter to Isaac Bartram;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conagocheage, L.S. 2p.and end. (see Ms. Comm.to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 4.) Concerning a vessel to sail on ice. Cf. Minutes, p.68.

did.unittitle: Letter to John Ewing, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end.and end. Enc. wanting. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Philology, literature, etc., vol. 1, no. 1.) Forwards memoir on the "Country of the Illinois, etc."

did.unittitle: Delineation of a Solar Shadow;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 1p.drawing. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Math.and astronomy. vol.1,no.3.) For fate of paper which accompanied this item, see: APS Minutes, (printed), p.68.

did.unittitle: Meteorological observations by David Jameson and John Page;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Virginia, D. 2p. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol.1, no.3a.)

did.unittitle: Extracts from the minutes;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 2p.and end. Relative to presentation of the Transactions, B.Franklin is mentioned twice.

did.unittitle: Letter to Tho[ma]s Coombe;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 3p.and end. (see Ms. comm.to the APS. Natural history, vol. 1, no. 2.) Sends prints. Natural history. Cf. Minutes, p.72.

did.unittitle: Astronomical observations;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [read] D.S. 3p. and end. (see Ms. comm. to the APS. Math. and astronomy, vol. 1, no. 10.) Cf. Minutes, p.70. Printed: R.S. Trans., vol. 64, 171.

did.unittitle: Concerning bathing in Sweden;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [read] D.S. 3p.and end. (see Ms. Comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no. 2.) Cf. Minutes, pp.73,74.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boutetourte County, Va., A.L.S. 3p.and end. Forwards specimen of moss used in dyeing. Plans of a silk reel. Cf. Minutes, p.79.

did.unittitle: Letter to [David] Rittenhouse, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [post]. A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol.1,no.1.) Account of the cold winter.

did.unittitle: Meteorological observations from Newton township and Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 11p. (see Ms.comm.to the APS Natural philosophy, vol.I, no.5-5b.)

did.unittitle: Hints for the Philosophical Society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 3p.and end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no.6.) Printed: Phila.soc.for promoting agriculture. Memoirs,vol.6,127ff. Cf.Minutes, p.79.

did.unittitle: Concerning the Aurora borealis;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bradford, [read] D. 3p.and end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 4.) Cf. Minutes, p.79.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robert Harris, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Balt[imore] County, A.L.S. 2p.and.,end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural history, vol. 1, no. 6.) Presents and describes an amphibious animal. Cf. Minutes, p.87.

did.unittitle: Letter to William Smith, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Salem, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. Enc.wanting. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1 no. 7.) Forwards paper on water spouts.

did.unittitle: Meteorological observations near Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 2p.and end. and end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 8.)

did.unittitle: Report of the committee to whom was referred the paper on the extraordinary cold at Northampton during,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelpia, 1 p. A.D.S.: James Mease. Work published in Transactions of Royal Society of London; therefore precluded from those of A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Account with the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D. 3p.and end. Mentions binding two volumes especially for B.Franklin.

did.unittitle: Letter to University of Aberdeen,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, Photo of A.L.S.: William Smith and Robert Strettell Jones. 2p. Presentation note on Vol.I, A.P.S. Transactions. Presented by University Library Kings's College, Aberdeen, Scotland, 1968.

did.unittitle: [Nov. 1780] Thermometrical observations at William & Mary College

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Therometrical observations originally enclosed in a note from Madison to Rittenshouse.

did.unittitle: Letter to Timothy Matlack, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lower Merion, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no. 3.) Concerning the death of his son, John. See Ms. Communications.

did.unittitle: List of donations made to the APS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: ca. 1793. In hand of John Vaughan. D. 1p.end.

did.unittitle: Letter to ----;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kentucky, A.L.S. 2p.,end. (see Ms.Comm. to the APS. Mechanics, Machinery, Eng., etc., no. 1.) Concerning a discovery of perpetual motion.

did.unittitle: Remarks on the fattening and curing of beef as could be best practiced in America;

scopecontent.p: D.S.with initial. 5p.and end. (see Ms. Comm.to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 7.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 1p.and end. (see Ms. Comm. to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 10) Cf. Minutes, p.144.

did.unittitle: Concerning magnetism;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 18p.and end. (see Ms. comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 12.) Cf. Minutes, pp.148-149.

did.unittitle: Letter to Benjamin Franklin;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 7p., end. and end. (see Ms. Comm.to APS. Natural Philosophy, vol. 1, no.14. ) Windmills and magnetic needle.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see Ms.comm. to the APS. Math. and astronomy, vol. 1, no.24.) Asks for copy of the report on his paper. Cf. Minutes, p.153.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Robert] Patterson;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friday [read] A.L.S. 2p.and add.,end. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no. 5.) Concerning W.Barton's observations on longevity in the U.S. Cf. Minutes, p.189.

did.unittitle: Letter to Rob[er]t Patterson;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and end. Enc. wanting. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural history, vol. 1, no. 10.) Forwards work by Mhlenberg. Cf. Minutes, p.189.

did.unittitle: Letter to the President of the A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L. 1p.and add.,end. Enc. (see Ms.Comm. to the APS. Mechanics, Machinery, Eng., etc., no. lla.) Encloses memoir for the premium. For enclosure, see: Scrupulous. Concerning...heat and cold upon springs; [read] Nov. 4, 1791.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Benjamin Smith?] Barton;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ipswich, A.L.S. 4p.,end. (see Ms. comm.to the APS. Philology, literature, etc., vol.I, no.3.) Concerning the age of Indian ruins in the Ohio country. Cf. Minutes, p.209.

did.unittitle: Letter to John Vaughan;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, L. 1p.,end. Enc. of 14p. and 2 drawings. (see Ms. Comm. to the APS. Mechanics, Machinery, Eng., etc., no. 12.) Provides plan and calculations for a mill utilizing Rumsey's invention.

did.unittitle: Concerning an improved manner of gauging;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [read] D.S.with initial. 18p.and 1 drawing and end. in hand of D.Rittenhouse. (see Ms. Comm.to the APS. Mechanics, Machinery, Eng., etc., no. 13.) For the premium. Cf. Minutes, PP.209, 210.

did.unittitle: Letter to the president of the A.P.S. Philadelphia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Natural philosophy, vol. 1, no. 19.) Concerning the climate of Pennsylvania from the records of the Swedish church. Cf. Minutes, p.212.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Letter to Benjamin Franklin, Pres. of A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: No. 2 Sommerset house [ca.]. A.L.S. 1p. and add., end. Presents to the A.P.S. his translations of Kalm's Travels, Bossu's Travels, and Catalogues of North American animals, American plants, and Centuria of new insects. Cf. Minutes May 1,1772. Date is before July when F. joined Cooks's expedition.

did.unittitle: Abbe [Francois] Rosier to

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presentation note to the American Philosophical Society to accompany Rosier's donation of a copy of his work entitled Demonstrations elementaires de botanique. Paris, Printed L.with ms.P.S. 3p.and end. In French. Presents two volumes to the APS. Refers to Franklin and de Magellan. Cf. Early minutes, Sept.17,1773. p.83 of printed Minutes.

scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], D. 4p. and end. Gives names of sponsors and election of nominees, among whom is B.Franklin.

did.unittitle: List of subscribers to A.P.S. Transactions,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: o.s., I, Philadelphia, 1 p. D.S. Of great value. Contains autographs of Benjamin Franklin, John Vaughan, David Rittenhouse, Caspar Wistar, and others.

did.unittitle: Letter to the A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Phila., A.L.S. 3p. and add. and end. drawings Addressed also to Benjamin Franklin. Lays before them some of his ideas of creating steam.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Lewis to [the American Philosophical Society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia], 2 pp. and endorsement. A.D.S. Legal opinion condemning the steps of Philosophical Hall as a nuisance. See Minutes, July 18, 1788, in Pro., XXII,pt. 3, 162.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no. 8.) Asks for copy of his machine for cleansing chimneys. See J.Rumsey. Description of a machine for cleansing chimneys; 1786.

did.unittitle: Improved method of finding longitude at sea;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S. 1p. and end. (see Ms. Comm.to APS. Math and Astronomy, vol. 1, no. 20.) Enclosed originally in letter from Byrnes to Franklin; Aug. 15, 1788. FILM 54-63 FRAME 52

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Franklin, Rittenhouse, John Vaughan;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Letter to [Benjamin Franklin];

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Letter to Benjamin Franklin;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. and add., end. Enc. (see Ms.Comm.to APS. Math and Astronomy, vol. 1, no. 19.) New quadrant. For enclosure, see Byrnes: improved method...longitude at sea; June 19,1788. FILM 54-63 FRAME 52

did.unittitle: Description of a wheelboat proposed to facilitate the navigation of the North American rivers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of a wheel boat that "may be worked alternately with and hands and feet . . , [that] will give a force from 3 to 6 times greater, than that of the arms moving an oar." Read before the 0society on September 19, 1788.

did.unittitle: Letter to the president and members of the A.P.S.;

scopecontent.p: Port au Prince, L.S. 1p. and end. Presents to the A.P.S. a copy of his [Etatdes finances de St. Dominique]. See Pro., XXII, pt. 3, 164.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Benjamin Franklin ?];

Original in volume of letters to St. John de Crevecoaur owned by M. Louis St. John de Crevecoeur, La Plagne, Montesquiou-sur Losse (Gers), France.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D.S. 3p.and end.by J.Vaughan. Covers period from April 24, 1786 to Jan. 19, 1791. Mentions number sent to B.Franklin.

did.unittitle: Letter to John Vaughan, Front Street;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. and add., end. (see Ms. Comm.to APS. Trade, navigation, etc., no.12.) Concerning his article on the sugar maple. Mentions T.Jefferson.

did.unittitle: G[eorge] Turner to the President of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 2 pp. and endorsement. A.L.S. Presents to A.P.S., in the name of Dr. Anthony Fothergill: (1) An Address to the King and Parliament of Great Britain, on preserving the lives of the Inhabitants, by W. Hawes, M.D.; (2) A new experimental Inquiry concerning the Cheltenham Water, by A. Fothergill; (3) An extract from a Journal of the Weather, kept during the year 1789 at Chevenage, in the county of Glocester. See Pro. XXII, pt. 3, 201, December 16, 1791.

did.unittitle: An address presented to David Rittenhouse in Society,

scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. D.S.: John Ewing and five others. Returning thanks of A.P.S. for payment of 300 debt by Mr. Rittenhouse.

did.unittitle: Letter to [David Rittenhouse];

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Buchan, David Stewart Erskine, Earl of, 1742-1829

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dryburgh Abbey, A.L.S. 8p. Presents a writing box dedicated to his use as president of the Philosophical Society. Describes box which contains pictures of Copernicus and Napier. With this letter is a typed copy of an item in the Public Ledger and Daily Transcript, July 9, 1885, about the box. Printed: APS Library Bulletin for 1950, p.292.

did.unittitle: Letter to M. L'Hritier;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostat of A.Dr. of L.S.: D. Rittenhouse, president of the APS. 1p. (On same sheet is draft of letter from Rittenhouse to M. Fauchet, same date) Acknowledges the receipt of his Stirpes Novae and Monographia Cornus, by the hand of M. Fauchet. Mentions Dr. Franklin. Presented by Princeton university library, from original in possession of Miss Elizabeth Sergeant Abbot, June 1954.

did.unittitle: Letter to [M. Fauchet];

Library, June 1954, from original in possession of Miss Elizabeth Sergeant Abbot. of M. Fauchet. Mentions Dr. Franklin. Presented by Princeton university library, from original in possession of Miss Elizabeth Sergeant Abbot, June 1954.

did.unittitle: Talbot Hamilton to John Vaughan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Donates piece of a loadstone from Schuyler's Mountain to A.P.S. See Minutes, September 19, 1806, in Pro., XXII, pt. 3, 389.

did.unittitle: The American Philo[sophica]l Society to Jacob Lybrand,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr., [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. D. Receipted by Jacob Lybrand. Receipted bill for $12.83, for making set of inside shutters for Philosophical Hall.

did.unittitle: The American Philosophical Society to F. R. Hassler,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr., 1 p. and endorsement. D. Receipted by F. R. Hassler. Receipted bill for $10, for Ren Just Hay, Trait de minralogie, 5v.

did.unittitle: Letter to John Vaughan;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, L.S. 10p.and end. In Spanish. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no. 31.) Concerning Lafuente's method of curing yellow fever. Cf. Minutes, pp.389, 391.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on [Anthony] Fothergill's paper on population;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Nich.Collin, Tho. C. James, and Zaccheus Collins. 1p.and end. Cf. Minutes, p.388.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on C[harles] W[illson] Peale's description of an American antelope;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: B.S. Barton. 1p.and end. Cf. Minutes, p.388.

did.unittitle: Concerning the cure of yellow fever;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [presented] D. 13p.and end. In Spanish. 10c8. (see Ms.Comm.to the APS. Medicine, anatomy and physiology, no.26.) Cf. Minutes, p.389.

did.unittitle: Am[erica]n Philos[ophical] Soc[iet]y to Geo[rge] Flake,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr., [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. D. Receipted by George Flake. Receipted bill for painting and plastering.

did.unittitle: Letter to ----;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Switzerland, L. Extract. 3p.and end. (see Ms.comm.to the APS. Philology, literature, etc., vol. 1, no. 21.) Concerning a landslide.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on papers on the eclipse by Ellicott and Dunbar, and Dunbar's paper on ascertaining longitude;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Ferrer and R.Patterson. 1p.and end. Cf. Minutes, p.389. Printed: Trans.,o.s.,vol.VI, 260ff. For Ellicott's paper, see:letter from Ellicott to R.Patterson;Aug.1,1806.

did.unittitle: Report of the committee to whom was referred Dr. [Anthony] Fotghergill's memoir on ice islands,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p. and endorsement. D.S.: Peter S. DuPonceau, Joseph Cloud, Sam[ue]l Moore. Publication not recommended, as anthor paper on the same subject is at present before the public.

did.unittitle: Letter to J.R. Coxe, secretary of the APS;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Calcutta, L.S: Wm. Hunter. secy. 1p. and end. Acknowledges books from APS.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Jones to John Vaughan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement. 3d. per. N. Presents five books of Chinese paintings of natural subjects to the A.P.S. See Minutes, December 5, 1806, in Pro. XXII, pt. 3, 391.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on [John] Hall's paper on navigation;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: R.Patterson and James Mease. 1p. Cf. Minutes, p.391.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on [Jos Joaquin] de Ferrer's paper on the eclipse;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Joseph Clay and R.Patterson. 1p. and end. Cf. Minutes, p.391. Printed: Trans.,o.s.,vol.VI, 264,293.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on Guyton [de] Morveau's paper on disinfecting the air;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Tho.C.James, Thos.T.Hewson and Jos.Cloud. 1p.and end. Refers to Jefferson. Cf. Minutes, p.391.

did.unittitle: Hu[gh] Williamson to James Mease,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Desires to have a copy of his paper on the fascination of serpents, in order to make additions thereto.

did.unittitle: Report of the committee appointed to examine the treasurer's accounts,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. D.S.: R[obert] Patterson, Joseph Cloud.
